name: Google Custom Search
description: This plugin lets site owners easily add Google's Custom Search Engine to their site.
author: TidyCustoms

messageInOptions.text: To use the search feature, make sure that both 'Search' and 'Search subpage' options are enabled in the Theme settings under the Search tab.

config.name: searchId
config.label: Search engine ID
config.note: For more information on how to find your Search engine ID, please visit the plugin's documentation.

config.name: searchParam
config.label: Search parameter
config.note: You can change the default "q" search parameter if desired; recommended only for advanced users.

config.name: searchAutofocus
config.label: Autofocus
config.note: When enabled, the autofocus attribute will be added to the input field to tell the browser to focus on this field when the page loads.

config.name: searchSubmitButtonInBox
config.label: Submit button
config.note: Displays the submit button in the search box. Please note that your currently-used theme may require some minor CSS customization in order to display the button correctly.

config.name: searchSubmitButtonOnPage
config.note: Displays the submit button on the search results page.

config.name: cookieBannerIntegration
config.note: Enabling this option will integrate this plugin with Publii's native Cookie Banner, allowing visitors to consent to cookies installed by Google. This option is recommended if you want to ensure compliance with privacy regulations.

config.name: cookieBannerGroup
config.label: Cookie Group ID
config.note: Please specify which Cookie Group ID of the Cookie Banner you wish to associate with the Google Custom Search script. If it does not exists, add a new Cookie Group Name with the Cookie Group ID specified above in the Privacy Settings section of the Site Settings. For more details please visit our documentation.

config.name: cookieBannerNoConsentText
config.label: Fallback message
config.note: Customize the message that appears when the user has not consented to use Google Custom Search scripts.
config.value: The search results are disabled because you have not consented to their use. You can change your cookie preferences through our 'cookie banner'.
